subject: Re: [junit] Test Case Results segregation
msgSnippet: Hi, Thanks for the reply. Different version means. A test function is added to a test class and thereby upgrades the version to a new no. There are other
messageBody:
Hi,
Thanks for the reply.

Different version means.
A test function is added to a test class and
thereby upgrades the version to a new no.
There are other functions in the same class
which belong to previous version. The idea is
to segregate which methods were recently added.

So far so good I have been able to use a doclet to
extract these methods using the @since javadoc tag.
This doclet has the logic to segregate these methods.

Now how do I integrate this with Junit.
Any suggestions?
Thanks
Raman

--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:

> ramandeep340 wrote:
> >
> >
> > Hello,
> >
> > I would like to know if there is a mechanism to
> segregate
> > test case results based on some version. e.g I
> have test
> > functions which were added in different versions
> of test
> > suite, can I segregate the results based on these
> versions.
>
> I don't understand "different versions of test
> suites". If you mean
> different versions of the same class, then you can't
> run those tests
> simultaneously, anyway. Tell us more about what, in
> general, you're
> trying to do.
>
> You can always use XSLT or XML parsing to analyze
> the test results that
> Ant generates with the <junit> task.
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com
> Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for
> Programmer Testing
>
